snippet: The transaction, is expected to bolster Liberty’s QVC Group business, but it also is only the latest instance of a company going public, then selling itself shortly afterward.
abstract: Flash-sale site Zulily agrees to buyout by Liberty Interactive that values company at $2.4 billion, which is 15 percent below price established during 2013 initial public offering; deal is latest in string of company sales well below IPO valuation.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and CHAD BRAY

lead_paragraph: The transaction, is expected to bolster Liberty’s QVC Group business, but it also is only the latest instance of a company going public, then selling itself shortly afterward.

headline.main: Liberty Interactive Agrees to Buy Zulily for $2.4 Billion
headline.print_headline: Sales Site Bought Out at Discount
